data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you always take the first step forward and never come back. If you always face left, you never take the second step forward and never come back. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The four steps are to take 4 steps. Turn around. If you leave now and turn around to return to the starting point, you will go around and turn right. So, the answer is no.

The walking directions repeat the same instructions from step 1, step 3, and step 4. In the running instructions: In the Walking instructions: In the running instructions: Take 4 steps. In the walking instructions: Take 6 steps. In the walking instructions: Take 4 steps. In the running instructions: Take 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

The following statement is TRUE. The first 7 steps is a series of one step instead of multiple one step additions. The starting point is a single step up from the original setting point. It takes more than one step. So, the answer is Yes.

All directions always have one moving part. A person facing forward cannot always be facing backwards. If you are facing backwards, you usually should never take five steps backwards or 2 steps right. If you were facing forward, you can always take 7 steps left. In total, the steps backward and forwards should never take 5 steps backwards or 2 steps right. In total, the steps forward and right should never take 7 steps right. So, the answer is No.
